sen.j: 郡山遺跡（こおりやまいせき）は、現在の宮城県仙台市太白区郡山に所在する古代の官衙（役所）跡である。
sen.e: The Koriyama Ruins are the site of an ancient kanga 'public offices) located in the present Koriyama, Taihaku-ku, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture.
The Koriyama Ruins are the site of an ancient kanga (public office) located in the present Koriyama, Taihaku-ku, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture.
The Koriyama Ruins are the site of an ancient kanga (public office) located in the present Koriyama, Taihaku Ward, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture.

sen.j: 7世紀中葉から8世紀前葉（おそらく724年）まで、より古いI期官衙、それに続くII期官衙、II期と同時期の郡山廃寺が営まれた。
sen.e: From the middle of the 7th century to the early 8th century (possibly 724) the older stage I kanga, the following stage II kanga and Koriyama-haiji Temple at the second stage were operated.
From the middle of the 7th century to the early 8th century (possibly 724) the older stage I kanga, the following stage II kanga and Koriyama-haiji Temple at the second stage were operated.

sen.j: 陸奥国の国府と推定される。
sen.e: It is presumed to have been the Kokufu (state office) of Mutsu no kuni..
It is presumed to have been the Kokufu (state office) of Mutsu no kuni..
It is presumed to have been the Kokufu (state office) of Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 国の史跡。

National historic site.
National historic site.

sen.j: 郡山遺跡は現在の宮城県仙台市太白区郡山2丁目～6丁目にあたり、かつては陸奥国名取郡に属した。
sen.e: The Koriyama Ruins are now located in 2 to 6-chome, Koriyama, Taihaku-ku, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture, once belonging to Natori-gun, Mutsu no kuni.

sen.j: 仙台市南部を流れる名取川と広瀬川 (宮城県)との合流点付近、両河川にはさまれた自然堤防上にある。
sen.e: It is on the natural embankment between two rivers, near where the Natorigawa River running through the southern part of Sendai City and the Hirosegawa River (Miyagi Prefecture) join.
It is on the natural embankment between two rivers, near where the Natorigawa River running through the southern part of Sendai City and the Hirosegawa River (Miyagi Prefecture) join.

sen.j: 周囲一帯には遺跡が多く、遺物埋蔵地が互いに隣接・連結する。
sen.e: There are a lot of ruins about the area and the sites where relics of the past are buried lie side-by-side and link together.

sen.j: 郡山遺跡はその中の一区画である。
sen.e: The Koriyama ruins are one compartment of the district..
The Koriyama ruins are one portion of the district.

sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、Koriyama Ruinsとしました。

sen.j: 郡山遺跡の西にある富沢遺跡は、弥生時代の水田・集落遺跡である。
sen.e: The Tomizawa ruins in the west of the Koriyama ruins are the ruins of sectional rice fields and settlements.
The Tomizawa ruins in the west of the Koriyama ruins are the ruins of sectional rice fields and settlements.
The Tomizawa Ruins in the west of the Koriyama Ruins are the ruins of sectional rice fields and settlements.

sen.j: 郡山遺跡からも、弥生土器が見つかっている。
sen.e: Some Yayoi potteries were also found in the Koriyama ruins.
Some Yayoi pottery has also been found in the Koriyama ruins.
Some Yayoi pottery has also been found in the Koriyama Ruins.

sen.j: 下から順に、弥生時代前期の青木畑式土器、中期中葉の崎山式土器、中期末の枡形囲式土器が出土した。
sen.e: From bottom up came potteries of Aokibatake-style in the early Yayoi period, Sakiyama-style in the middle of the Middle Yayoi period and Masugata-style in the end of the Middle Yayoi period.
sen.cmt: 青木畑 読み方不明
sen.e: From bottom up came potteries of Aokibatake-style in the early Yayoi period, Sakiyama-style in the middle of the Middle Yayoi period and Masugata-style in the end of the Middle Yayoi period.

sen.j: 中期中頃以前の水田跡も見つかっている。
sen.e: Remains of rice fields before the middle of the middle Yayoi period were also found.
Remains of rice fields before the middle of the middle Yayoi period were also found.

sen.j: I期官衙

sen.j: 南北620m、東西400m以上の規模で、建物の基準線は真北から西に50-60度傾き、南東辺を正面としたらしい。
sen.e: It is assumed that the office was 620m long from south to north, 400m long from east to west, the base line of the building pointed 50 to 60 degrees west from true north, and the front was at the southeast side.

It is assumed that the office was 620m long from south to north, 400m long from east to west, the base line of the building pointed 50 to 60 degrees west from true north, and the front was at the southeast side.

sen.j: 外郭は材木を並べて立てて作った塀で、全体の形は長方形、長い辺が560メートル以上、短い辺が295.4メートルある。
sen.e: The surrounding structure was a wall built of lumber put up in a row, the entire shape formed a rectangle with the longest side 560m long and the short side 295.4m long.

sen.j: 4辺のうち北東辺だけが見つかっていないので、長辺の正確な長さは不明である。
sen.e: Of the four sides the northeast side has not been found, so the exact length of the long side remains unknown.
Of the four sides the northeast side has not been found, so the exact length of the long side remains unknown.
Of the four sides the northeast side has not been found, so the exact length of the long side remains unknown.

sen.j: 内部は板塀や材木列で区画され、区画の中に複数の建物が多数建てられた。
sen.e: The inside was comparted by boarding fences and a row of lumber, and a lot multiple buildings were built in the compartment.
The inside was partitioned by boarding fences and a row of lumber, and a lot multiple buildings were built in the compartment.
The inside was partitioned by boarding fences and a row of lumber, and a lot multiple buildings were built in the compartment.

sen.j: 政庁と思われる中枢区と、その周りに倉庫区、北雑舎区、南雑舎区、竪穴区があったことが判明しているが、まだ全体の一部しかわかっていない。
sen.e: We know that the central compartment may have been the government office, and around it there were a warehouse compartment, the north multipurpose house compartment, the south multipurpose house compartment and the pit house compartment, but still we know only part of the whole thing.

We know that the central compartment may have been the government office, and around it there were a warehouse compartment, the north multipurpose house compartment, the south multipurpose house compartment and the pit house compartment, but still we know only part of the whole thing.

sen.j: 北雑舎区の南には鍛冶工房があった。
sen.e: There was a blacksmiths' workshop in the south of the north multipurpose building compartment.
There was a blacksmiths' workshop in the south of the north multipurpose building compartment.
There was a blacksmiths' workshop in the south of the north multipurpose building compartment.

sen.j: 発掘された土器の中で多数を占めるのは地元のものだが、関東系土師器もあり、飛鳥III式と呼ばれる畿内系土師器も少数出土している。
sen.e: Most of the unearthed potteries were local ones, but some were Kanto-style Haji potteries and a small number of Kinai-style Haji potteries called Asuka type II were also found.

sen.j: 年代は、7世紀中葉から7世紀末葉と考えられる。
sen.e: The age can be thought to be from the middle 7th century to the late 7th century.
The age can be thought to be from the middle 7th century to the late 7th century.
The age can be thought to be from the middle seventh century to the late seventh century.

sen.j: 建物配置と倉庫群の存在は律令制下の国衙とは似ず、むしろ郡衙と似るが、郡衙にない内部区画がある。
sen.e: The building placement and the existence of a group of warehouses were, under the ritsuryo system, similar to those of the gunka (regional office), but not of the kokuga (state office), but there were inner compartments which the gunka did not have.

sen.cmt: ritsuryo systemの補足追加 (用語集参照)

sen.j: 古墳時代の大集落であった南小泉遺跡が、I期官衙の造営と入れ替わりに規模を縮小したことが指摘される。
sen.e: It is pointed out that the South Koizumi Ruins, a large settlement in the Kofun period, scaled back because of the construction of the stage I kanga..

sen.j: 7世紀後半における大和朝廷の陸奥国経営における重要拠点であり、もう少し踏み込んで言うなら初期の陸奥国府と推定される。
sen.e: In the latter half of the 7th it is an important place for the Yamato Dynasty to rule Mutsu no kuni, and speaking a little more daringly, it was presumably the early provincial capital of Mitsuno ku ni.

sen.j: II期官衙
sen.e: Stage II Kanga
Stage II Kanga
Stage II Kanga

sen.j: II期官衙はI期の建物を取り壊し、これと重なる位置に真北を基準にして造営された。
sen.e: The stage II kanga was established, on the standard of true north, where the destroyed stage I buildings were.
The stage II kanga was established, on the standard of true north, where the destroyed stage I buildings were.

sen.j: 四辺の位置が判明している。
sen.e: The positions of the four sides are known.
The positions of the four sides are known.

sen.j: 全体を囲う外郭は南北422メートル、東西428メートルで、材木塀と大溝からなる。
sen.e: The surrounding structure is 422m long from south to north, 428m from east to west and consists of a lumber wall and a big ditch.
The surrounding structure is 422m long from south to north, 428m from east to west and consists of a lumber wall and a big ditch.
The surrounding structure is 422m long from south to north, 428m from east to west and consists of a lumber wall and a big ditch.

sen.j: 塀は太さ約25ないし30センチメートルの柱を隙間なく立て並べて作ったもので、その周りの溝は幅約2.5メートル、深さ約60センチメートル。
sen.e: The moat was made of pillars 25 to 30cm in thickness that were closely put up in a row, and the ditch around it is 2.5m in width and 60cm in depth.
The moat was made of pillars 25 to 30cm in thickness that were closely put up in a row, and the ditch around it is 2.5m in width and 60cm in depth.
The moat was made of pillars 25 to 30cm in thickness that were closely put up in a row, and the ditch around it is 2.5m in width and 60cm in depth.

sen.j: 溝は材木列から9メートル離れて外側をめぐった。
sen.e: The ditch went round the outside, 9m away from the lumber row.
The ditch went round the outside, 9m away from the lumber row.
The ditch went round the outside, 9m away from the lumber row.

sen.j: 南辺中央部には門跡、南西隅および西辺の2ヶ所で櫓状建物があった。
sen.e: At the center of the south side there were a remainder of the gate and tower-like building at the southwest and west corners.
At the center of the south side there were a remainder of the gate and tower-like building at the southwest and west corners.

sen.j: 南門以外の門は見つかっていない。
sen.e: No other gate except the south gate has been found.
No other gate except the south gate has been found.
No other gate except the south gate has been found.

sen.j: 中央やや南寄りに政庁の正殿と推定される東西に長い四面庇付きの掘立柱建物がある。
sen.e: A little to the south of the center there is a structure supported by posts in the ground extending long from east to west and with eaves on the four sides, which is assumed to have been the main building of the government office.

A little to the south of the center there is a structure supported by posts in the ground extending long from east to west and with eaves on the four sides, which is assumed to have been the main building of the government office.

sen.j: その北に石を敷きつめた場所があり、北東に石組池がある。
sen.e: o its north there is a stone paved place and a rockwork pond to the northeast.
To its north there is a stone paved place and a stonework pond to the northeast.
To its north there is a stone paved place and a stonework pond to the northeast.

sen.j: 池の北と西にはやはり石組みの溝が取り付いて水を通した。
sen.e: In the north and west, as was expected, there was a rockwork ditch which let water run into the pond.
In the north and west, as was expected, there was a stonework ditch which let water run into the pond.

sen.j: 建物は、外郭の南側の外にもあった。
sen.e: There were also buildings outside of the south of the surrounding structure.
There were also buildings outside of the south of the surrounding structure.

sen.j: 南西には同時期に付属寺院（郡山廃寺）が造営された。
sen.e: In the southwest an attached temple (Koriyama-haiji Temple) was built around the same time
In the southwest an attached temple (Koriyama-haiji Temple) was built around the same time.

sen.j: ここからは多賀城と似た瓦が出土している。
sen.e: Here roof tiles similar to those of Taga Castle were excavated.
Here roof tiles similar to those of Taga Castle were excavated.
Here roof tiles similar to those of Taga-jo Castle were excavated.

sen.j: 出土した土器は、8世紀以降の陸奥国府である多賀城の初期の土器より古い。
sen.e: Unearthed potteries are older than those of early-stage Taga Castle, the kokufu (state government) of Mutsuno ku ni after the 8th century.
Unearthed potteries are older than those of early-stage Taga Castle, the kokufu (state government) of Mutsuno ku ni after the 8th century.
Unearthed potteries are older than those of early-stage Taga-jo Castle, the kokufu (state government) of Mutsu Province after the eighth century.
sen.cmt: Taga-jo Castleとし、Mutsuno ku ni→Mutsu Province、8th→eighthに修正

sen.j: 基本的な配置が律令制下の他の国府と同じなので、多賀城以前の陸奥国府と推定される。
sen.e: Because the basic arrangement is the same as that of other kokufu under the ritsuryo system, it is assumed to have been a kokufu prior to Taga Castle.
Because the basic arrangement is the same as that of other kokufu under the ritsuryo system, it is assumed to have been a kokufu prior to Taga Castle.
Because the basic arrangement is the same as that of other kokufu under the ritsuryo system, it is assumed to have been a kokufu prior to Taga-jo Castle.

sen.j: しかし石組池は他の国府に見られない特徴で、類例は飛鳥にしかない。
sen.e: However, rockwork ponds are not seen in other kokufu except for in Asuka.
However, stonework ponds are not seen in other kokufu except for in Asuka.
However, stonework ponds are not seen in other kokufu except for in Asuka.

sen.j: 蝦夷の服属儀礼に伴うものではないかとする説がある。
sen.e: Some theories suggest that it was related to the ritual of obedience of Ezo.
Some theories suggest that it was related to the ritual of obedience of Ezo.
Some theories suggest that it was related to the ritual of obedience of Ezo.

sen.j: II期官衙の年代は、7世紀末葉から8世紀初頭と考えられており、多賀城創建前後に廃絶した。
sen.e: The stage II kanga is thought to have existed from the late 7th to the early 8th centuries and was abolished before and after the foundation of Taga Castle.
The stage II kanga is thought to have existed from the late 7th to the early 8th centuries and was abolished before and after the foundation of Taga Castle.
The stage II kanga is thought to have existed from the late seventh to the early eighth centuries and was abolished before and after the foundation of Taga-jo Castle.

sen.j: 神亀元年（724年）に多賀城が作られたとの多賀城碑の文に従えば、廃止はこの年である。
sen.e: According to the epigraph of Taga Castle monument when Taga Castle was built in 724, it was abolished in this same year.
According to the epigraph of Taga Castle monument when Taga Castle was built in 724, it was abolished in this same year.
According to the epigraph of Taga-jo Castle monument when Taga-jo Castle was built in 724, it was abolished in this same year.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、Taga-jo Castleとしました。

sen.j: 郡山廃寺は8世紀後半まで存続した。
sen.e: Koriyama-haiji Temple existed until the latter half of the 8th century.
Koriyama-haiji Temple existed until the latter half of the 8th century.
Koriyama-haiji Temple existed until the latter half of the eighth century.

tit.e: History of Excavation and Current State
History of Excavation and Current State
History of Excavation and Current State

sen.j: 郡山遺跡からは、後に郡山廃寺と名づけられた場所から、多賀城のものと似た瓦が見つかっていたが、長く調査の手がつけられなかった。
sen.e: Though roof tiles similar to those of Taga Castle were found in the Koriyama Ruins at the place that was later called Koriyama-haiji Temple, research had been untouched for a long time.
Though roof tiles similar to those of Taga Castle were found in the Koriyama Ruins at the place that was later called Koriyama-haiji Temple, research had been untouched for a long time.
Though roof tiles similar to those of Taga-jo Castle were found in the Koriyama Ruins at the place that was later called Koriyama-haiji Temple, research had been untouched for a long time.

sen.j: 1979年（昭和54年）に仙台市教育委員会が調査を開始し、廃寺とI期、II期の官衙を確認した。
sen.e: In 1979 Sendai City Board of Education began investigating and confirmed the existence of the abandoned temple and stage I and II kanga.
In 1979 Sendai City Board of Education began investigating and confirmed the existence of the abandoned temple and stage I and II kanga.
In 1979 Sendai City Board of Education began investigating and confirmed the existence of the abandoned temple and stage I and II kanga.

sen.j: 以後、数十次にわたる発掘調査が実施され、2006年現在も継続中である。
sen.e: Since then tens of excavation researches were performed, and in 2006 to date they have been going on.
Since then tens of excavations were performed, and in 2006 to date they have been going on.
Since then tens of excavations were performed, and in 2006 to date they have been going on.

sen.j: 発掘当初は、陸奥国府説と並んで、名取郡の郡衙や、文献に名が出ない城柵ではないかとする推測もあったが、 現在ではII期官衙を多賀城以前の陸奥国府とするのが定説である。
sen.e: In the early stage of excavation there was a presumption that it was a gunga regional public office) of Natori-gun along with a kokufu of Mutsu no kuni or a stockade of a castle whose name does not appear in documents, but at present the accepted theory is that the stage II kanga was the kokufu of Mutsu no kuni before Taga Castle was.

In the early stage of excavation there was a presumption that it was a gunga (regional public office) of Natori-gun along with a kokufu of Mutsu no kuni or a stockade of a castle whose name does not appear in documents, but at present the accepted theory is that the stage II kanga was the kokufu of Mutsu no kuni before Taga Castle was.

In the early stage of excavation there was a presumption that it was a gunga (regional public office) of Natori County along with a kokufu of Mutsu Province or a stockade of a castle whose name does not appear in documents, but at present the accepted theory is that the stage II kanga was the kokufu of Mutsu Province before Taga-jo Castle was.
sen.cmt: Natori-gun→Natori County、Mutsu no kuni→Mutsu Province、Taga Castle→Taga-jo Castleに修正

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）には官衙遺跡の下層から弥生土器が見つかり、官衙以前にも集落があったことが示唆された。
sen.e: In 1987 Yayoi potteries were found in the lower layer under the kanga ruins, suggesting that there was a settlement prior to the kanga.
In 1987 Yayoi pottery was found in the lower layer under the kanga ruins, suggesting that there was a settlement prior to the kanga.
In 1987 Yayoi pottery was found in the lower layer under the kanga ruins, suggesting that there was a settlement prior to the kanga.

sen.j: 遺構は、地表面から3～5メートル程度の深さに位置している。
sen.e: The remains are located in the ground about 3 to 5m deep.
The remains are located in the ground about 3 to 5m deep.
The remains are located in the ground about three to five meters deep.
sen.cmt: 3 to 5m→three to five metersとしました。

sen.j: かつて一帯は水田地帯であったため、損傷を受けることはほとんどなかった。
sen.e: They had hardly been damaged because this area was a paddy field zone before.
They had hardly been damaged because this area was a paddy field zone before.
They had hardly been damaged because this area was a paddy field zone before.

sen.j: 現在は市街地の下にあり、工事のときに小区画を調査するしかない。
sen.e: Because they are now under the ground of an urban area, research can be conducted only in a small compartment when there is construction work.
Because they are now under the ground of an urban area, research can be conducted only in a small compartment when there is construction work.
Because they are now under the ground of an urban area, research can be conducted only in a small compartment when there is construction work.

sen.j: 郡山遺跡一帯には高層建築が許可されていない。
sen.e: High buildings are not permitted in the Koriyama Ruins Zone.
High buildings are not permitted in the Koriyama Ruins Zone.
High buildings are not permitted in the Koriyama Ruins Zone.

sen.j: 現在、一部は長町副都心「あすと長町」の範囲に含まれ、土地区画整理事業及びそれに伴う発掘が行われている。
sen.e: Now part of the zone is included in the area of "Asuto-nagamachi", the Nagamachi subcenter, and a land readjustment project and excavation accompanied by the project have been going on.
Now part of the zone is included in the area of "Asuto-nagamachi", the Nagamachi subcenter, and a land readjustment project and excavation accompanied by the project have been going on.
Now part of the zone is included in the area of "Asuto-nagamachi," the Nagamachi subcenter, and a land readjustment project and excavation accompanied by the project have been going on.

sen.j: 隣接する遺跡「西台畑遺跡」（にしだいはたいせき：地元では「にしだいばたけ」と呼ばれることが多い）や長町駅東遺跡は、郡山遺跡に勤務していた人々が生活したものと考えられる住居跡などが発見・発掘されたが、旧国鉄(JR)長町レールセンター、旧国鉄(JR)長町貨物ヤード(操車場)＜共に現在は廃止＞建設によると思われる損傷、ライフラインの埋設による損傷がみられた。
sen.e: In the adjoining ruins "Nishidaihata Ruins" (locally often called "Nishidaibatake" and Nagamchi East Station Ruins, the remains of residences and so on where people working in the Koriyam Ruins had presumably lived were found and excavated, but they had been damaged probably by the construction of old Japanese National Railway (JR) Nagamachi Rail Center and old JR Nagamachi Yard (now both of them are abolished) and work of burying infrastructure.

In the adjoining ruins "Nishidaihata Ruins" (locally often called "Nishidaibatake") and Nagamchi East Station Ruins, the remains of residences and so on where people working in the Koriyam Ruins had presumably lived were found and excavated, but they had been damaged probably by the construction of old Japanese National Railway (JR) Nagamachi Rail Center and old JR Nagamachi Yard (now both of them are abolished) and work of burying infrastructure.

In the adjoining ruins "Nishidaihata Ruins" (locally often called "Nishidaibatake") and Nagamchi East Station Ruins, the remains of residences and so on where people working in the Koriyam Ruins had presumably lived were found and excavated, but they had been damaged probably by the construction of old Japanese National Railway (JR) Nagamachi Rail Center and old JR Nagamachi Yard (now both of them are abolished) and work of burying infrastructure.

sen.j: なお、郡山遺跡の区域内に「仙台市立郡山中学校」があり、一階部分(通常の地表面よりも1.5メートル程高くなっている)に遺構を再現した資料室があるが、普段は施錠され、人の出入りはない。
sen.e: Moreover, in [ ] in the Koriyama Ruins zone there is a data room which reproduces the remains on the first floor (which is 1.5m higher than the ground level, but the room is usually closed with no visitors allowed.

Moreover, in [ ] in the Koriyama Ruins zone there is a data room which reproduces the remains on the first floor (which is 1.5m higher than the ground level, but the room is usually closed with no visitors allowed.

Moreover, in Sendai City Koriyama Junior High School which is in the Koriyama Ruins zone there is a data room which reproduces the remains on the first floor (which is 1.5m higher than the ground level, but the room is usually closed with no visitors allowed.
sen.cmt: 「」内の単語「仙台市立郡山中学校」が抜けていたため、ウェブより補い訳出しました。 High Schoolの後ろにwhich is を補足しました。

sen.j: 2006年7月28日に、遺跡の重要部分約4.3平方キロメートル(現在その大部分は休耕田または空地)が「仙台郡山官衙遺跡群」として国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: On July 28, 2006 about 4.3 square kilometers of the important part of the ruins (now most of the part is fallow fields or idle land) was designated as a national historical site named "Sendai Koriyama Kanga Ruins Group ".

On July 28, 2006, about 4.3 square kilometers of the important part of the ruins (now most of the part is fallow fields or idle land) was designated as a national historical site named "Sendai Koriyama Kanga Ruins Group".

On July 28, 2006, about 4.3 square kilometers of the important part of the ruins (now most of the part is fallow fields or idle land) was designated as a national historical site named "Sendai Koriyama Kanga Ruins Group."
